title: Relative motion - toy plane in windy conditions

content.question: A toy plane which maintains an airspeed <math alttext="v sub p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>p</mtext></msub></math> flies between points <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> in a time <math alttext="t sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> when there is negligible wind. When the air is moving at a velocity of <math alttext="one half v sub p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>p</mtext></msub></math> from Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> to Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, the toy plane can make the trip from <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> to <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> in <math alttext="t sub A B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub></math>, and the return trip from <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> to <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> in <math alttext="t sub B A, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>BA</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>. How do the three travel times compare?

choices.label: <math alttext="t sub A B, end sub, is greater than t sub 0, which is greater than t sub B A, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>BA</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t sub B A, end sub, is greater than t sub 0, which is greater than t sub A B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>BA</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t sub A B, end sub, equals t sub B A, end sub, which is greater than t sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>BA</mtext></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>></mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t sub 0 is greater than t sub A B, end sub, which equals t sub B A, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>BA</mtext></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="t sub A B, end sub, is greater than t sub 0, which is greater than t sub B A, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>BA</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
